Assign a completion status to individual sections of your model documentation that will be reflected in your Document Overview.

::: {.callout title="Section statuses cannot be assigned on static PDF documents."}
You can only assign section statuses for PDFs converted to editable documents,[^1] documents generated by the {{< var validmind.developer >}}, or documents created in the {{< var validmind.platform >}}.
:::

::: {.attn}

## Prerequisites

- [x] {{< var link.login >}}
- [x] The model you are documenting is registered in the model inventory.[^2]
- [x] You are a [{{< fa code >}} Developer]{.bubble} or assigned another role with sufficient permissions to perform the tasks in this guide.[^3]

:::

## Steps

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} Inventory**.

2. Select a model or find your model by applying a filter or searching for it.[^4]

3. In the left sidebar that appears for your model, click **{{< fa file >}} Documents** and select the **Latest** tab.[^5]

4. Click on a Documentation type file.[^6]

   Jump to any section of the model documentation by selecting the relevant section you would like to view.

4. Next to the heading of each section, you can assign a status from the drop-down:
    - [**In Progress**]{.bubble}
    - [**Done**]{.bubble}

The documentation completion status summary will then be updated on your Document Overview page.
